title: Drawing, Facade des Magasins de M.M. Mappin & Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires [Shop Facades of M.M. Mappin &  Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires], ca. 1925
title_raw: Facade des Magasins de M.M. Mappin & Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires [Shop Facades of M.M. Mappin &  Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires]
medium: Brush and black and gray wash, turquoise watercolor, pen and brush and white gouache, graphite on gray paperboard; ruled border in gold ink
markings: At lower right: small [1/2 x 1 in.] stamp in black: LEY  7092/9510/DE PROTECCION/ A LA/PROPIEDAD/ARTISTICA; on verso, center:  large [2 3/8  x 1 1/2 in.] shield-shaped stamp in blue [date in red]:  KILEMNICK E CIA/ 524 FLORIDA/ 9 Novembre 1928/V. T. 31 [REC?] 3648
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower left of image:  Kilemnik & Cia/arqos [os is underlined] [architects]; at upper left,  FACADE DES MAGASINS DE M.M./MAPPIN & WEEB/A BUENOS AIRES/FLORIDA 32 [SHOP FACADES OF M.M./MAPPIN AND WEEB/BUENOS AIRES/32 FLORIDA]; along left edge,  Revêtements de/marbre noir et/marbre gris; Filets d'onyx/vert ou moulu/rés emaillées; Glaces des vi/trines encadrées/de metal argen/té; Bases et portes/de fer forgé [Revetments of/black and gray marble; Bands of green onyx/or enameled moldings/;glass vitrines framed in silver met/al; Bases and doors/of wrought iron]
description: Elegant store facade with deep central entrance with double doors between angled vitrines. The vitrines facing the street display assorted gift items.  Running horizontally across the upper part of the facade, beneath black recessing,  gray marble inscribed with signage (name of shop and European cities where shop branches are located).  Dado decorated with repeated octagonal pattern. Pedestrians are indicated at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Facade des Magasins de M.M. Mappin & Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires [Shop Facades of M.M. Mappin &  Weeb, Florida 32, Buenos Aires], ca. 1925. Brush and black and gray wash, turquoise watercolor, pen and brush and white gouache, graphite on gray paperboard; ruled border in gold ink. 
Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-10
